question: 十日
sourceMnemonic: <vocabulary>Tenth day</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>day ten</vocabulary>. No matter how you look at this word, it makes a lot of sense.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Words that count days use an exceptional reading. Even though this is a jukugo word, it uses kun'yomi readings for both the kanji. Think about this word this way:

On the <vocabulary>tenth day</vocabulary>, they'll <reading>tow</reading> your <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>とおか</ja>). They'll let it sit there for <vocabulary>ten days</vocabulary>, but any more than that and they'll tow it, so watch out.
